      • takeItem

        public boolean takeItem(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        String id,
                        int amount)
        take item from player.

        Example) /trg run IF takeItem(player, "STONE", 1); #MESSAGE "Removed one stone."; ELSE; #MESSAGE "You don't have a stone"; ENDIF;

        You can find item names in Material
        Specified by:
        takeItem in class AbstractCommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        player - target player
        id - item id
        amount - amount
        Returns:
        true if took it; false if player doesn't have it

      • takeItem

        public boolean takeItem(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        String id,
                        int amount,
                        int data)
        take item from player.

      • makePotionEffect

        public org.bukkit.potion.PotionEffect makePotionEffect(String EffectType,
                                                       int duration,
                                                       int amplifier,
                                                       boolean ambient,
                                                       boolean particles,
                                                       org.bukkit.Color color)
        Description copied from class: AbstractCommonFunctions
        create a PotionEffect for use in entity.addPotionEffect();

        Example) /trg run player.addPotionEffect( makePotionEffect("SPEED", 1000000, 5, false, true, bukkitColor(21,2,24) ))

        Specified by:
        makePotionEffect in class AbstractCommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        EffectType - the name of the PotionEffectType to use
        duration - how long the potioneffect should last when applied to an enitity
        amplifier - how strong the effect should be
        ambient - if true particle effects will be more transparent
        particles - if false potion particle effects will not be shown
        color - use bukkitColor() or is no longer available since 1.13
        Returns:
        returns a PotionEffect object or null if specified PotionEffectType was not found.

      • headForValue

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack headForValue(String textureValue)
        Create a player head with given textureValue(base64 encoded).

        Example) /trg run #GIVE headForValue("eyJ0ZXh0dXJlcyI6eyJTS0lOIjp7InVybCI6Imh0dHA6Ly90ZXh0dXJlc y5taW5lY3JhZnQubmV0L3RleHR1cmUvN2RjZDdkZjUyNjQ1YzY4Y2RhZDg1NDhlNjFiM2Y3 NjU5NjQwNzcyMjZiYTg3MmI5ZDJiZDQ1YzQzOWQifX19\\")

        Notice that there is an extra \ sign as \ is an escape sequence. The final String will be ...OWQifX19\ instead of ...OWQifX19\\"

        Specified by:
        headForValue in class AbstractCommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        textureValue - base64 encoded texture value
        Returns:
        the ItemStack head

      • serializeLocation

        public SerializableLocation serializeLocation(org.bukkit.World world,
                                              double x,
                                              double y,
                                              double z)
        Create a new SerializableLocation, which implements ConfigurationSerializable

        Example) /trg run serialized = serializeLocation("wildw", 2, 13, 44)

        Specified by:
        serializeLocation in class AbstractCommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        world - The world instance in which this location resides
        x - The x-coordinate of this location
        y - The y-coordinate of this location
        z - The z-coordinate of this location
        Returns:
        The SerializableLocation value

      • serializeLocation

        public SerializableLocation serializeLocation(org.bukkit.World world,
                                              double x,
                                              double y,
                                              double z,
                                              double yaw,
                                              double pitch)
        Create a new SerializableLocation, which implements ConfigurationSerializable

        Example) /trg run serialized = serializeLocation("wildw", 2, 13, 44.6, 13)

        Specified by:
        serializeLocation in class AbstractCommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        world - The world instance in which this location resides
        x - The x-coordinate of this location
        y - The y-coordinate of this location
        z - The z-coordinate of this location
        yaw - The absolute rotation on the x-plane, in degrees
        pitch - The absolute rotation on the y-plane, in degrees
        Returns:
        The SerializableLocation value
